body: A man stabbed his ex-girlfriend to death in her apartment in Brooklyn yesterday morning, then wounded two other people on his way out of the building, the police said. The suspect, Norman McClean, of Jamaica, Queens, was charged with murder and two counts of attempted murder, the police said last night. The police identified the dead woman as
title: Woman Stabbed to Death, And Queens Man Is Charged

body: Three police officers were hit by a drunken driver yesterday as they investigated the death of a man who had been struck by a vehicle in Crown Heights, the police said. The officers, who suffered minor injuries, had responded to what appeared to be the suicide of a man who was run over after lying down on Bedford Avenue, the police said. The police
title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Police Car Hit At Scene Of Death

body: Attractions Museums AMERICAN MUSEUM OF THE MOVING IMAGE 36-01 35th Avenue, at 36th Street, Astoria, Queens. Through Jan. 2005, ''Loews Cineplex Entertainment 100th Anniversary,'' an exhibition of photographs, film clips and other items that documents the development of the corporation, from penny arcade to multiplex theaters. Two panel discussions
title: Spare Times

body: A man shot his former girlfriend to death in his basement apartment in St. Albans, Queens, during the weekend, before turning the gun on himself yesterday, the police said. The bodies of the couple, both immigrants from Guyana, were discovered in the man's bed in his apartment at 110-08 204th Street about 10 a.m. yesterday, according to
title: Police Say Queens Man Killed Woman and Himself

body: A 15-year-old boy was fatally shot last night and two other young men were wounded when gunfire broke out in front of a liquor store on Flatbush Avenue in Brooklyn, the police said. Relatives said the boy, Eric Johnson, was on the way to a deli and was caught in the hail of bullets. When the shooting broke out, at 8:20 p.m., Flatbush Avenue was
title: 15-Year-Old Boy Dies and 2 Men Are Hurt in Brooklyn Shooting

body: ATTRACTIONS Museums and Sites MERCHANT'S HOUSE MUSEUM, 29 East Fourth Street, East Village. This preserved late-Federal brick house with a Greek Revival interior, once owned by Seabury Tredwell, a wealthy hardware dealer, was built in 1832. Saturdays through May, ''Behind the Scenes: A Rare Opportunity to View the Servants' Quarters,'' with tours
title: SPARE TIMES

body: NEXT Sunday, 1880 Bedford Avenue will be ready for its close-up, burnished by Windex and a Swiffer mop, by Benjamin Moore and Pratt & Lambert, with elbow grease and a family spat or two, for an annual spring rite that comes around Brooklyn neighborhoods as regularly as hay fever, and causes nearly as much irritation -- at least to some homeowners.
title: Habitats/Prospect Lefferts Gardens; The Three Sisters' Jewel Is Ready for All Comers

body: THE seasonal flurry of show houses and house and garden tours offers visitors a chance to peek behind closed doors and garden gates, and sample ideas from proud renovators, backyard horticulturists and interior designers. The following listing includes events in the Northeast. Unless otherwise noted, the tours are self-guided. New York City
title: Hedges and Hearths: Spring Parade for Homes and Gardens

body: New York City's 11 public hospitals have no common security system, no uniform method of screening visitors or restricting their access to certain wards of a hospital building. Background checks on new employees can vary widely from one institution to another. In fact, despite the employment of its own 850-member police force, and even after years
title: Security System At Hospitals Draws Scrutiny

body: STOOP life thrives in Prospect-Lefferts Gardens, a small neighborhood in central Brooklyn south of Crown Heights and just east of Prospect Park. People have either lived here for ages or moved in within the last decade, drawn to the interracial blend as well as the stone row houses, which are considered more affordable than their counterparts in
title: If You're Thinking of Living In/Prospect-Lefferts Gardens; Convenient and Close-Knit Yet Diverse

body: The videotape slowed to instant replay speed, and Officer Charles Dorcent, who had been leaning both elbows on the wooden courtroom defense table all morning, slumped back into his chair, shrugged his shoulders and let out a deep breath. The next few seconds on the tape, familiar from countless broadcasts on television news programs a year and a
title: Arrest Videotape at Issue In Officer's Assault Trial

body: More than 60 drivers in the Prospect-Lefferts Gardens neighborhood of Brooklyn awoke yesterday to find tires on their vehicles slashed, the police said. The first call came to the police at 7:20 a.m., from Rutland Road between Flatbush and Nostrand Avenues, east of Prospect Park, the police said. The heaviest concentration of damaged vehicles
title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Scores Of Cars Slashed

body: A 12-year-old boy was fatally injured by a car in Brooklyn last night, the police said. The victim, Nysean Gayle of 417 Ocean Avenue, died at Kings County Hospital Center at 9:35 p.m., the police said. Another boy, also 12, suffered minor injuries in the accident. The boys walked onto Bedford Avenue from between two parked cars near the corner of
title: Boy, 12, Struck and Killed By Car on Brooklyn Street
